definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Fame, wealth, knowledge are merely mundane possessions which could be achieved by anybody striving for them.
sentences.chinese: 名聲，財產，知識是身外之物，人人都可求而得之。

sentences.english: Everything in the world is outside you but health belongs to yourself .
sentences.chinese: 切都是身外之物，只用健康屬於自己。

sentences.english: Monks are wise, they don't worry about money.
sentences.chinese: 出家人是聰明的，因爲他們不在乎身外之物。

sentences.english: Man’s love is of man’s life a thing apart, it is woman’s whole existence.
sentences.chinese: 愛情對男子不過是身外之物，對女人卻是整個生命。

sentences.english: Other people's money, but my money.
sentences.chinese: 別人的錢財，乃我的身外之物。

sentences.english: Everythingin the world is outside you but health belongs to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 一切都是身外之物，只用健康屬於從彼。

sentences.english: The fame thing isn't really real, you know.
sentences.chinese: 名聲只是身外之物，你知道嗎？

sentences.english: I'm not impressed by outward symbols, such as money or status.
sentences.chinese: 我不會被金錢名譽這些身外之物所博束。

sentences.english: Possessions are worse than worthless — they're harmful.
sentences.chinese: 身外之物不僅沒有用處，它們甚至有害。

sentences.english: May you not become too concerned with material matters, but instead place immeasurable value on the goodness in your heart.
sentences.chinese: 願你不要太看重身外之物，你心中的善才價值無限。

definition: position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
to look upon as dirt/considered worthless
to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
lit. human beings will die for riches, just as birds will for food (idiom)/fig. man will do anything in his means to become rich
pinyin: ren2 wei4 cai2 si3 , niao3 wei4 shi2 wang2

definition: mere worldly, superficial gain, such as wealth and fame
